title: LightGuide
description: A Light Guide coupling between the light source and the microscope generally consists of a casing enclosing a medium capable of transferring light from the illuminator to the back of the microsocpe body.
subCategoriesOrder: ManufacturerSpec:This is the base from which many microscope components are extended. E.g Objective, Filter etc. Provides attributes for recording common properties of these components such as Manufacturer name, Model etc. All of which are optional
CouplingLens:This is a reference to a lens positioned at connector between this light source coupling element and the microscope body.
WavelengthRange:This records a range of wavelengths associated with the associated microscope component. Multiple of this elements may be used.

Type.description: The type of light guide used in this case.

PeakWavelength.description: The wavelength associated with maximum light intensity transmitted by this light guide

RefractiveIndex.description: The refractive index of the material this light guide is made of

NumericalAperture.description: The numerical aperture of the light guide expressed as a floating point (real) number. Expected range 0.02 - 1.5

AcceptanceAngle.description: The angle within which light beam may be coupled into the bound modes of an optical fiber.

MaterialName.description: This records the chemical composition or the nonproprietary trade designation of the material used for this light guide

SingleMode.description: Records whether or not the light guide is single-mode. If not, then the guide is assumend to be multi-modal

WaveguideMode.description: When boundary conditions are imposed by a physical structure, a wave of a particular frequency can be described in terms of a transverse mode (or superposition of such modes). These modes generally follow different propagation constants

Diameter.description: The outer diameter of the light guide

Name.description: A user defined name for this component.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this component.

Transmittance.description: The maximum amount of light this LightSourceCoupling apparatus is capable of transmitting at the peak wavelenght. It is represented as a fractional value from 0.0 to 1.0.

SerialNumber.description: The serial number of this component

LotNumber.description: The lot number of this component

SpecsFile.description: Provide the location of a PDF file with the specifications for the component as provided by the manufacturer.

CouplingLens.description: This is a reference to a lens positioned at connector between this light source coupling element and the microscope body.

Description.title: Description
Description.description: This is a simple multi-line comment or annotation describing this component.

WavelengthRange.description: This records a range of wavelengths associated with the associated microscope component. Multiple of this elements may be used.

CutIn.description: CutIn is the wavelength below which the response rate is below 50%.

CutOut.description: CutOut is the wavelength above which the response rate is below 50%.

WavelenghtProfile.description: The location of a file containing the wavelenght profile of this component.

Tier.description: The tier level of this component.
